Question: The density of ice is less than that of water because of what intermolecular force?
Source Sentence (en): Water has a relatively higher boiling point (100 °C) than hydrides of other group 16 elements of the same family (e.g., H2S [boiling point: -60.7 °C]) because the attraction between molecules becomes very strong due to hydrogen bonds. In addition, when water is converted into ice, its volume increases because the triangular structure of water molecules becomes honeycombed by hydrogen bonds, creating many cavities in it.
Source Sentence: 水が同族の他の第16族元素の水素化物（H2S〔沸点: ?60.7 ℃〕など）より比^的高い沸点（100 ℃）を示すのは、水素Y合によって分子gの引力が非常にくなるためである。また、水が辘浠するHに体eが大するのは、水分子の三角造が水素Y合で蜂のz状になり、そこに空洞が多く生まれるためである。

Question: What color is diazomethane?
Source Sentence (en): In pure form, diazomethane is a yellow-colored gas. For laboratory practice, it is usually used as a solution in diethyl ether. It is a convenient source of carbene radicals and a mild alkylating agent.
Source Sentence: В чистом виде диазометан?― газ жёлтого цвета. Для лабораторной практики, как правило, он используется в виде раствора в?диэтиловом эфире. Удобный источник карбеновых радикалов и мягкий алкилирующий агент.

Question: Will silver mirror reaction occur when silver ammonia solution is added to ketone?
Source Sentence (en): The silver mirror reaction is a chemical reaction in which a compound with a formyl group is oxidized by Thorens' reagent (ammoniacal silver nitrate solution) to form carboxylic acid (*strictly speaking, ammonium carboxylate) and reduced silver is deposited. It was discovered in the first half of the 19th century.

Question: Is it true that the functional group of both alcohols and phenols is the hydroxyl group, so alcohols and phenols belong to the same class of organic compounds?
Source Sentence (en): Although structurally similar to alcohols, phenols are relatively unique and not in the same class of compounds as alcohols, primarily because the phenolic hydroxyl group is attached to an unsaturated carbon atom. Because the aromatic ring of phenols is tightly bound to the hydroxyl oxygen atom, and the chemical bond between the oxygen and hydrogen atoms of the hydroxyl group is not as strong, phenols are more acidic than alcohols. The acidity of the hydroxyl group on phenols is usually between that of fatty alcohols and carboxylic acids (their pKa is usually between 10-12).
Source Sentence: 虽然结构与醇类似，但酚的性质相对独特而与醇不属同类化合物，这主要因为酚羟基连接于不饱和碳原子上。由于酚类的芳香环紧密的与羟基氧原子结合，而相对使羟基的氧原子与氢原子之间的化学键不是那么牢固，因此酚比起醇类化合物具有更强的酸性。酚上的羟基酸性通常间于脂肪醇与羧酸之间（它们的pKa通常在10-12之间）。
